Milan, Maldini touches on Ibrahimovic and the Rossoneri transfer market

After two wins against Parma and Bologna, Milan take the field again today where they will face Sassuolo. The hope is for Pioli's men to win a third straight match to confirm their recent results and performances. Paolo Maldini spoke to Sky Sport about the current state of affairs for the rossoneri.

"Ibrahimovic? He is an option that we are evaluating, but not the only one. The deeper we get the more difficult it becomes, the last game he has played remains two and a half months ago, and considering the time it will take him to get back to his best, we will only have him for five months, not more."

"Duarte's injury has worried us, it put us in a little defensive emergency. Fortunately, Caldara's return cheers us up in this point of view."

"At the beginning we chose Giampaolo because we were looking for someone with precise ideas, who brought strong concepts along with him. Too bad it didn't work out and we signed Pioli, one who has shown to have great personality and who is in symphony with the directors. The team is good, we suffer a bit due to inexperience but the conditions are there to do well."

Manchester United are in talks with Red Bull Salzburg over a January transfer for Erling Haaland, but contrary to reports the club did not make a move for the Norwegian’s team-mate Takumi Minamino.

Instead, United’s efforts are being put into securing Haaland, and to that end Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and Ed Woodward travelled to Austria to meet the player’s representatives on Friday.

It is believed United have been given encouragement from the 19-year-old striker, who struck up a good relationship with Solskjaer while they were together at Molde, and Red Bull are open to a sale when trading begins.

As previously reported by The Athletic, the presence of Mino Raiola as Haaland’s agent does add another factor, though. It is believed Raiola would prefer Haaland to move to another club first, before joining United — and discussions have also been held with RB Leipzig and Borussia Dortmund.

[David Ornstein]

Chelsea’s Ake clause close to expiring

No conversations took place between the clubs over the weekend, though that could change at any moment and even if another side comes in with a higher offer for the Holland international, Chelsea will have first refusal to recruit him at the price reserved for them alone.

While Ake has also been watched closely by Manchester City and some of the leading Spanish teams, they have not established formal contact with Bournemouth. If any of them were to make a move, it could only materialise if Chelsea stood aside or Ake rejected the Blues.

When Chelsea received a transfer ban — covering the summer 2019 and winter 2020 windows — Bournemouth were delighted because the Ake clause is scheduled to expire before the summer 2020 window opens.

[David Ornstein]

Thomas Lemar has no intention of leaving Atletico Madrid – entourage

RMC Sport report that Ligue 1 club Lyon were this morning notified by the entourage of 24-year-old French international attacking midfielder Thomas Lemar that the player has no intention of leaving Atletico Madrid next month.

As far as the outlet is concerned, Lyon’s Lemar dream is already over, despite only making formal contact with Atletico on Monday.

The ex-AS Monaco player wants to try to turn his form around in the Spanish capital and to continue to work under the orders of Diego Simeone, before reflecting and making a firmer decision on his future at the end of the season.

Monaco boss Leonardo Jardim could face the sack with a poor result this weekend

Monaco-Matin report that AS Monaco manager Leonardo Jardim could face the sack if he fails to obtain a positive result in Saturday’s Ligue 1 home match against Lille.

After suffering a 3-0 home loss against the same opponent in the Coupe de la Ligue last night, the Portuguese tactician is back in the firing line. Sections of the Stade Louis II crowd were seen chanting “Jardim resign”.

The local outlet believes that a second loss to Les Dogues in this space of a week could prove fatal for Jardim, who had the following to say after last night’s performance:

“I understand the fans, they love the club, they love good football, we have had good results recently, they are demanding more. They want to win matches, that’s normal. But the coaching staff also wants to win matches. The players too.”

Montpellier have an interest in Moussa Sylla (AS Monaco)

Eurosport report that Ligue 1 side Montpellier are seeking to add an attacker to their ranks next month to provide adequate cover for their current duo of Andy Delort and Gaëtan Laborde.

They are at the same time seeking to offload 29-year-old Serbian forward Petar Škuletić, who notably has received interest from Greece.

Their number one target in attack appears to be 20-year-old AS Monaco striker Moussa Sylla, who has played just 8 minutes of competitive action under manager Leonardo Jardim so far this season.

Lyon in active discussions with Steven N’Zonzi

Eurosport report that Lyon have opened formal discussions with French international defensive midfielder Steven N’Zonzi about a possible January move.

This information comes from well-placed Turkish sources, who understand that Galatasaray are looking to end their season-long loan deal with AS Roma for the 31-year-old 6 months early.

This would allow OL to sign him on loan – the player is interested in a move to Lyon as a good landing point away from his difficult time in Turkey and also it would allow him to get back on Didier Deschamps’ radar, half a year away from EURO 2020.

Inter push to sign Kulusevski: meeting with Atalanta to discuss possible summer move

Inter have stepped up their interest in 19-year-old Dejan Kulusevski, one of this season's breakout players so far. On Wednesday, Atalanta and Inter's officials held a meeting to discuss the future of the Swede, currently on loan at Parma.

The Nerazzurri's objective is to try and forestall the other suitors and close the deal with Atalanta, although the move would be postponed until next June as Parma have shown themselves unwilling to let the player go in January. In virtue of the excellent relationship between the chairmans of the clubs - Zhang and Percassi - Inter would like to agree a pre-emption on the player and then formally close the deal after the end of the January transfer window, from 1st February onwards. Inter would prefer to make the deal official - for a sum of €35 million - only during the summer transfer window as their plan is to invest the funds for the January transfer window on players that would have an immediate impact on Conte's team.

However, this matter could cause a problem in the path to a possible agreement as Atalanta would like to be able to sell the player already in January in case a high bid from a different club arrived, even though the move to another club would happen in the summer. Atalanta are open to wait for Inter (and they would accept the terms offered by the Nerazzurri), provided that no other club makes a higher bid and accepts Atalanta's conditions. Napoli prepare bid for Celta Vigo's Lobotka: the details

After making an offer to Hellas Verona for Amrabat and Rrahmani, Napoli are pondering their next moves in order to bring in some reinforcement to Gattuso's team. For the midfield, the partenopei have made Celta Vigo's 23-year-old player Stanislav Lobotka their main target for the January transfer window, since a deal with Arsenal for Torreira - one of the midfielders linked to Napoli - appears quite difficult.

Napoli have prepared an initial bid of €15 million plus bonuses against an asking price set at €25 million. Lobotka, who has a €50 million release clause in his contract with Celta Vigo, will be offered a four- or five-year-deal with a salary of €2 million per season after taxes. The Slovakian has already talked with his fellow countryman and former Napoli captain Marel Hamsik about the club and would be open to accept a move to the partenopei. Napoli have already made contact with the player's agents and might submit the aforementioned bid to Celta Vigo in the coming days.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/napoli-prepare-bid-for-celta-vigos-lobotka-the-details

Inter, from Vidal to Giroud & Marcos Alonso: the latest on nerazzurri

Inter are looking to bolster their squad during the January window to keep their scudetto dreams alive. The nerazzurri are looking to improve at multiple positions inter coming weeks

Defense

The priority is at the wing back position, but there aren't the financial conditions to sign Marcos Alonso or Emerson, in addition Chelsea do not want to sell them. Even Kurzawa's potential arrival is rather complicated which is why Darmian's candidacy is gaining traction.

Midfield

The nerazzurri are focused on reuniting Arturo Vidal with Antonio Conte, the Chilean international would like to be sold and the parties are at work to reach an agreement. Vidal's potential transfer to Inter could also create some good Will for some potential future negotiations in the summer, with Barcelona's interest in Lautaro Martinez being well known.

As has happened on previous occasions, Juventus are looking to insert themselves in the negotiation and have contacted Barcelona in the last hours to gauge the situation. However Inter are serene as they have started the negotiations significantly earlier and have a good relationship with Barcelona.

Attack

Inter have stayed in contact with Chelsea for Giroud and with Napoli on a potential loan swap of Politano for Llorente.

Julian Weigl (Borussia Dortmund) the subject of a €20m transfer to Benfica

Julian Weigl has ruled out a contract extension beyond 2021 and is therefore likely to leave Borussia Dortmund, according to regional outlet Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung (WAZ).

This coincides with a report by Correio da Manhãon via Zach Lowy on Monday evening that Benfica have been in talks with the Bundesliga club to sign Weigl for €20 million.

Barcelona will loan out Jean-Clair Todibo until the end of the season; he has a choice of 7 clubs

L’Équipe, Foot Mercato and RMC all report that Catalan giants Barcelona have decided to loan French defender Jean-Clair Todibo out until the end of the season without an option to buy.

The player has been in talks lately with the following sides who have all made contact: Everton, Southampton, Watford, Bayer Leverkusen, AS Monaco and AC Milan.

However, many of these teams wanted the player on loan with an option to buy, which FCB are now refusing to include.

Foot Mercato believes that it is the following sides that would accept a loan with no option: Southampton, Schalke 04, Bayer Leverkusen, Hertha Berlin, Watford, AC Milan and AS Monaco.

The player will make his decision in the second week of January as was always planned.

Local paper Le Progrès report that Ligue 1 side Lyon have begun internal conversations about the possibility of bringing back Dominican Republic striker Mariano Diaz from Real Madrid.

The 26-year-old has no future under Zinedine Zidane, with AS Roma having also positioned themselves. Los Blancos are willing to loan him out until the end of the season, for no loan fee, in exchange for the club that takes him on paying the entirety of salary, believed to be around €2m.

The concern is that nobody quite knows the player’s level right now, having been without regular playing time for several months.

Lille have received six proposals for Boubakary Soumaré

L’Équipe report that Ligue 1 side Lille have received about a half-dozen proposals for 20-year-old midfielder Boubakary Soumaré ahead of the January transfer window.

Les Dogues refused Wolves’ €40m offer that came in several months ago.

There are three options for the French youth international midfielder going into next month: a permanent move, a permanent move but loaned back to Lille until the end of the season, a permanent move at the end of the season.

Manchester United, Tottenham, Napoli, Real Madrid and Valencia are all interested in a deal.

Zanetti confirms Inter want Vidal

Inter Vice President Javier Zanetti has confirmed the club’s interest in Arturo Vidal, adding fuel to rumours earlier this week that the Nerazzurri were working towards signing the Chile international from Barcelona.

“We’ll see how the transfer window goes, as we have a month to get things done,” Zanetti told ESPN in Argentina on Monday night. “Vidal is a player with great character and experience, so we’ll see what happens. We are talking about a player who can certainly step us up a level, and we are already at a good level.”

Early stage contacts between Steven N’Zonzi and West Ham & Everton

Téléfoot report that early stage contacts have occurred between Premier League duo West Ham United and Everton and French international defensive midfielder Steven N’Zonzi about a possible January move.

The 31-year-old, who is currently on loan from AS Roma at Galatasaray, wants to leave the Turkish side halfway through this agreement.

Lyon have also been in contact, but the player prefers a move to the Premier League, either permanently or on an initial loan basis.

At the moment, it is believed that the player is not atop of any of these three sides’ shortlists and that so far he has merely been sounded out.

Everton & Lyon have made Adrien Rabiot a priority; Juventus intend to keep

Both Everton and Lyon had several days ago made French international midfielder Adrien Rabiot their January window priority on loan until the end of the season without an option to buy, but Juventus have no intention of letting him go, according to TF1.

Rabiot, who would like a loan to receive increased playing time ahead of EURO 2020, has been wanted very much by his former coach Carlo Ancelotti at Everton.

At Lyon, although the club’s board are not united in the belief that the side needs to recruit a central midfielder this month, Rabiot is the absolute priority of Sporting Director Juninho on the same terms.

Juventus however have no intention of letting him go. Chapter closed.

Manchester United & Chelsea register interest in signing Edinson Cavani for free in summer

L’Équipe report this morning that a pair of Premier League sides have been alerted to the fact that Edinson Cavani will now almost certainly not be renewing his contract with PSG, which expires in this coming June.

As reported yesterday, the player has pre-contract agreement in place with Atletico Madrid to join them next summer on a 2-year deal, but has yet to sign it.

This gives other interested parties a chance, even though it seems clear that Cavani’s mind is made up: he wants to join up with Diego Simeone’s side.

衞冕冠軍練馬師蔡約翰，雖然上月於國際賽憑「爭分奪秒」揚威香港短途錦標，但今季暫時僅累積15場頭馬，比起上季同期28W足足大減近一半，成績大為失色。不過，蔡約翰作風向來慢熱，相信餘下馬季將可急起直追。

周三2020年首次谷草夜賽，蔡廐派出的六匹參戰馬，季內均曾於谷草贏馬或上名，出馬陣容強勁，可望助練者保持對上三年新一年谷草首戰例贏的優良傳統。

第5場「多多」、第9場「金匯昇」及第8場「明駿之星」，季內均曾贏出，其中「明駿之星」今季跑過6場，在谷草1200米取得2冠4季全上名佳績，演出極之準繩，今戰續於三班出擊，加上回配莫雷拉可望延續佳績。

另外，第4場「魅力漢子」，出自去年3月香港國際馬匹拍賣會出品，身價650萬元，兩周前在谷草1200米首次出賽，結果僅敗四分三馬位獲亞，已見爭勝能耐，力足補中開胡。

周三2020年首次谷草夜賽，蔡廐派出的六匹參戰馬，季內均曾於谷草贏馬或上名，出馬陣容強勁，可望助練者保持對上三年新一年谷草首戰例贏的優良傳統。

第5場「多多」、第9場「金匯昇」及第8場「明駿之星」，季內均曾贏出，其中「明駿之星」今季跑過6場，在谷草1200米取得2冠4季全上名佳績，演出極之準繩，今戰續於三班出擊，加上回配莫雷拉可望延續佳績。

另外，第4場「魅力漢子」，出自去年3月香港國際馬匹拍賣會出品，身價650萬元，兩周前在谷草1200米首次出賽，結果僅敗四分三馬位獲亞，已見爭勝能耐，力足補中開胡。

Neymar’s camp opens door to PSG contract extension

Speaking to Le Parisien, a member of the entourage of Brazilian superstar Neymar opened the door to contract extension talks with PSG.

“If PSG want to have discussions, we will listen to what they have to say. Last spring, Neymar was very close to extending his contract, and it was PSG who had been after that to happen. If the board want to have discussions, they have to come and see us.”

“[Ney] is happy like he hasn’t been for a really long time… [An extension] is possible if PSG gets the results and wins. Because Neymar wants to win.”

The Brazilian’s current contract expires in 2022.

Nabil Bentaleb seeking Schalke exit door, Crystal Palace in contact

Schalke 04 midfielder Nabil Bentaleb is desperately seeking a January window exit door as he remains frozen out of the Bundesliga side’s squad since he was first discarded in mid-April last year following a training ground incident.

Our colleagues at Foot Mercato report that Bentaleb’s January window priority is either a return to Ligue 1 or the Premier League.

S04 have no intention of retaining a player that they bought for €22.5m two-and-a-half years ago, and would prefer to sell him this month but are also open to a loan with option to buy if the eventual possible fee is considerable enough.

Crystal Palace are amongst several English sides interested in a deal, alongside two French clubs whose names have yet to filter through. In Italy, AC Milan have also placed the Algerian on their shortlist.

Atletico Madrid are in active negotiations with PSG to sign Edinson Cavani this month

RMC Sport report that Spanish side Atletico Madrid are in active negotiations with PSG Sporting Director Leonardo about the possibility of signing Edinson Cavani this month, despite reportedly already having a pre-contract agreement with the Uruguayan for when he leaves the French capital at the end of his current deal in June.

The French outlet claims that Cavani’s agreement with Atletico is actually a 2.5 year contract which is only currently valid if he were to join them this month.

The Spanish club wants to beat competition from Chelsea and Manchester United, who are both interested in acquiring the 32-year-old on a free transfer in summer, by offering PSG a transfer fee to take him off their hands in January.

Talks to this effect are currently ongoing, but the Paris club does not want to let their highest goalscorer in club history leave in the middle of the season.

This is a newsflash for Cavani’s camp, because at the end of 2019, it was more the player who was really wanting to go to the end of his Paris contract. His lack of recent playing time had under Thomas Tuchel since convinced him to be open to the idea of a January departure.

RMC confirm Manchester United and Chelsea interest in Cavani, but as of yet only for the summer window.

Newcastle & Ajax in talks for Ryan Babel (Eurosport)

Our colleagues at Eurosport FR report that Premier League side Newcastle United, as well as Dutch giants Ajax, are in talks over the possible signing of Dutch international winger Ryan Babel.

The 33-year-old is looking to leave Galatasaray and interested sides are expected be able to prise him away for a minimal fee as, despite being contracted until June 2022, the Turks are eager to offload him.

DORTMUND ADAMANT SANCHO WILL STAY

Borussia Dortmund are adamant Jadon Sancho will not leave the club in the January transfer window, Sky in Germany has learnt.

The England international has no release clause in his long-term contract that currently keeps him at the club until end of June 2022.

Borussia Dortmund feel they would not be able to find a suitable replacement in this window. However, a summer move for Sancho looks a lot more likely with most European clubs showing interest in the 19-year old.

Chelsea, Manchester City, Manchester United, PSG, Real Madrid and Barcelona have all made initial enquiries.

PSG expect Edinson Cavani to stay until the summer when his contact expires with his most likely destination being Atletico Madrid. They are prepared to let him go without a fee then. I’m told they’ve not heard from Manchester United or Chelsea.

Inter, from Young to Vidal & Eriksen: the latest on nerazzurri

With a title race with rivals Juventus on deck for second half of the season, Inter are working on improving Antonio Conte's squad. Ashley Young has already agreed to terms with the nerazzurri on a contract for a season and a half, there should be no issues reaching an agreement with Manchester United especially since Inter are willing to pay a nominal fee to bring Young to Milano.

Arturo Vidal continues to be the main target for the midfield. During Barcelona's trip to Saudi Arabia where they will play in the Spanish Super Cup, Messi, Suarez and Jordi Alba tried to convince him to stay. Inter aren't however giving up and he remains the primary objective, his agent could meet with the nerazzurri in Milano soon.

In the background we have Christian Eriksen who is mainly a target for next season since he has an expiring contract with Spurs who are looking to monetize rather than losing him on a Bosman deal, they are looking for €20 million but his arrival would exclude Vidal's because of the cost.

Kylian Mbappé swerves contract extension question: “It is not the moment to talk about that.”

Speaking following PSG’s 6-1 Coupe de la Ligue quarter-final victory over St Étienne, Kylian Mbappé dodged a question in the mixed zone about the status of ongoing discussions with the club for a contract extension.

“My desire is simply to play football, to be concentrated on the the season. The club is in a calm, stable situation, it is not the moment to talk about that, it is the moment to play football, there are quite a lot of challenges ahead, I simply want to focus on my season.”

Lille very open to selling Boubakary Soumaré this month

Mohamed Bouhafsi of RMC Sport tonight provided an update on the
future of Lille midfielder Boubakary Soumaré.

He claims that Lille are very open to selling the French youth international this month, reiterating his reporting from last summer that Wolves made a bid worth more than €40m back then.

Now, in January, he claims that Arsenal, Manchester United, Chelsea, Atletico Madrid and Real Madrid are all interested in doing a deal.

Eurosport add Tottenham Hotspur on that list as a club that wants to acquire the player this month.

The player will have to make a decision as the interest is high and the oral offers are around €50m. Soumaré wants to stay at Lille until the end of the season, unless he is forced to leave the club, which could occur at the board’s say so.

LOSC want a decision on this quickly, because it informs their transfer policy for the rest of the midfield, notably for Brazilian midfielder Thiago Maia, who has an offer from Flamengo and a Turkish club.
Fenerbahce are now trying to rapidly close a deal with AC Milan for Ricardo Rodriguez, according to @ManuLonjon.

Hertha Berlin inform Lyon they will not improve upon their €25m offer for Lucas Tousart

Eurosport report that German side Hertha Berlin have recently informed Lyon that they will not improve upon their €25m offer for French defensive midfielder Lucas Tousart.

OL rejected an opening €20m bid for the 22-year-old, before receiving the latest improved offer last week.

Lyon will now have a definitive decision to make on whether or not to sell the player – Hertha have made it clear that the time for negotiating is over.

Cenk Tosun joins Palace on loan



Turkish international Cenk Tosun has joined Crystal Palace on loan from Everton until the end of the season.

The forward, 28, has scored 118 club goals in a 10-year professional career spanning three countries and three different leagues. Internationally, Tosun chose to represent Turkey after playing between Under-16 and Under-21 levels for Germany, his country of birth. He featured for Turkey in their Euro 2016 campaign and finished as top scorer in the country's successful qualification for Euro 2020, and has now scored 16 goals from 40 international appearances.

After Tosun put pen to paper in the half-season deal, Crystal Palace Chairman Steve Parish commented: "We're delighted to have secured Cenk's services for the remainder of this season. We've enjoyed a great first half of the campaign and Cenk's arrival will bolster our squad as we push for a top-half Premier League finish. Cenk has a proven record as a goalscorer and we've admired him for some time, so I'm very pleased to welcome him to Crystal Palace."

Tosun has a wealth of experience at domestic level, having started his career with German side Eintracht Frankfurt before moving to Süper Lig team, Gaziantepspor. In his debut season with the Turkish club, the forward scored 10 goals from just 14 appearances and went on to net 49 times in 128 games. A highlight at Gaziantepspor came when Tosun bagged a brace in his club's Spot Toto Cup-winning final against Orduspor.

Tosun's proficiency earned him a transfer to Turkish giants Beşiktaş. With the Black Eagles, Tosun scored 24 times to retain the Süper Lig title in 2016/17. Having earned Champions League experience at Beşiktaş, Tosun moved to Everton in January 2018. The Toffees finished eighth in Tosun's first campaign and the frontman netted 10 times for the Merseysiders.

He will wear the No.20 shirt for Palace.
